text.p: Philips Electronics NV said on Friday it agreed to transfer its multimedia software publishing and distribution activities to Infogrames Entertainment, a French-based group in which Philips already had a 13.2 percent stake.

Philips said in a statement that Infogrames, based in Villeurbanne, France, was already European leader in interactive publishing and, with this deal, becomes the strongest European entertainment company in interactive publishing and software distribution.
Philips Media and Infogrames have been in partnership for several years, jointly producing interactive software titles such as Chaos Control, Marco Polo and International Tennis Open.
At the end of last year Philips held a 13.2 percent stake in Infogrames. This will increase after completion of the deal.

A Philips spokeswoman declined to give financial details of the transaction or define how big Philips' stake would be after the deal's completion. "We're not giving a figure but it will stay a minority," she said.
Industry sources estimated the annual turnover of the assets to be transferred at around 200 million guilders.
